title: 4D Reconstructions for Bronchoscopies
desc: We are creating a synthetic dataset of bronchoscopic videos in dynamically breathing lung models and designing a 4D reconstruction pipeline that leverages geometric deformation cues and temporal alignment

title: Improving Endoscopic SLAM with NFL-BA
desc: NFL-BA augments dense visual SLAM for endoscopy by integrating near-field lighting cues into the bundle adjustment objective, improving pose tracking accuracy by +30% with predicted depths and achieving state-of-the-art results on the C3VD dataset.

title: Controllable Sim-to-Real Translation for Colonoscopy
desc: PPS-Ctrl conditions a Stable Diffusion model with ControlNet on Per-Pixel Shading representations to enforce lighting-consistent structure, producing more photorealistic sim-to-real colonoscopy translations and enhancing depth estimation accuracy.

title: NBV Selection for Resource-Efficient 3D Reconstruction
desc: Our View Inference Network encodes partial 3D reconstructions and predicts the most informative next viewpoints, improving reconstruction quality by roughly 30% compared to coverage-based baselines under acquisition and motion constraints.

title: Reinforcement Learning for the Toyota HSR
desc: We built Gazebo/OpenAI Gym environments for the Toyota HSR and apply reinforcement learning with temporal-logic constraints, yielding policies that reliably satisfy assistive-task specifications and safety requirements on the robot platform.

title: Online Learning for Multi-Label Medical Images
desc: We extend CNN architectures with stability-enhancing update rules and dynamic sampling to tackle highly imbalanced multi-label medical image streams in an online learning setting, maintaining accuracy and robustness during continuous model updates.

title: Modulation of TTBK1 and TTBK2 Impacts Ciliogenesis
desc: We tackled how two kinases, TTBK1 and TTBK2, regulate the assembly and length of primary ciliaâ€”a key organelle in cell signaling. I gained hands-on experience in immunofluorescent staining, fluorescence microscopy, image analysis, and creating quantification pipelines.

title: BAZ2/BRD9 Bromodomain Inhibitor Induces Apoptosis in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
desc: We tested whether BAZ2/BRD9 inhibition induces apoptosis in TNBC cells. I assisted with culture and drug treatments and gained skills in western blotting, gel electrophoresis, plasmid prep, and bacterial transformation.
